title.narrative: Pasture and Livestock Management Improvement Project

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective is to improve community based pasture and livestock management in the Project area

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :4.01 Additional Events of Suspension | Description :The Additional Events of Suspension consist of thefollowing, namely, that ARIS’s Legislation has been amended, suspended, abrogated, repealed or waived so as to affect materiallyand adversely the ability of ARIS to perform any of its obligations under the Project Agreement. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.1. Project Operational Manual | Description :The Recipient, through the APIU, shall andshall cause ARIS to implement, respective parts of the Project in accordance with the provisions of the Project Operational Manual.| Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.5. Disbursement Specialist | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that within sixty(60) days of the Effective Date, APIU and ARIS each retain the services of a disbursement specialist for the Project. | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.B.1. Proceeds of the Financing | Description :To facilitate the carrying out of PartsI.A(iii) and (v), Part I.C(iv), Part II.A(i), Part II.B(ii) and (iv), and Part III(ii) of the Project by ARIS, the Recipient shallmake part of the proceeds of the Financing available to ARIS under a subsidiary agreement between the Recipient and ARIS, underterms and conditions agreed by the Association (“Subsidiary Agreement”). | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.B.2. Exercise of the Rights | Description :The Recipient shall exercise its rights underthe Subsidiary Agreement in such manner as to protect the interests of the Recipient and the Association and to accomplish thepurposes of the Financing. Except as the Association shall otherwise agree, the Recipientshall not assign, amend, abrogate orwaive the Subsidiary Agreement or any of its provisions. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.D.1. Sub-Grants | Description :The Recipient shall cause ARIS to make available Sub-Grantsto Beneficiaries and to carry out the Graduate Incentive Program under Parts I.A(v), I.C(iv), Part II.A(i), and Part II.B(ii) and(iv) of the Project in accordance with eligibility criteria and procedures set forth in the Project Operational Manual andacceptable to the Association. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.D.2. Sub-Grants | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that said Sub-Grants are madeavailable to Beneficiaries by ARIS through Sub-Grant Agreements executed by ARIS and each Beneficiary on terms and conditionsacceptable to the Association, including those referred to in Section I.D.3 of Schedule 2. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.D.3. Sub-Grants | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that the terms and conditions ofSub-Grant Agreements provide ARIS the right to: suspend or terminate the right of the Beneficiary as stated Section I.D.3 (a), andrequire each Beneficiary to carry out the statements referred to in Section I.D.3 (b)(i)-(vii) of Schedule 2. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.D.4. Sub-Grants | Description :For PUU Sub-Grants implemented pursuant to Part I.A.(v),the Recipient shall ensure ARIS requires that any PUU receiving a PUU Sub-Grant has: (a) a community-based pasture management planapproved by its Aiyl Kenesh after approval by the Pasture Department; and (b) agreed in the Sub-Grant Agreement to contribute aminimum of 25% of the total value of the micro-project, including 5% in cash. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.D.5. Sub-Grants | Description :For PUU Sub-Grants implemented pursuant to Part I.C.(iv) ofthe Project, the Recipient shall ensure that ARIS requires that: (a) noSub-Grant exceeds the equivalent of $10,000; and (b) any PUUreceiving a PUU Sub-Grant has done statements referred in Section I.D.5.(b)(i)-(iii). | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.D.6. Sub-Grants | Description :For PUU Sub-Grants implemented pursuant to Part II.A.(i) ofthe Project, the Recipient shall ensure that ARIS requires that: (a) noSub-Grant exceeds the equivalent of $1,400; and (b) the PUUSub-Grant is used only for contracting the services of private veterinarians selected by the PUU. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.D.7. Sub-Grants | Description :For Private Veterinarians Sub-Grants implemented pursuantto Part II.B.(ii) of the Project, the Recipient shall ensure that ARIS requires that: (a) no Sub-Grant exceeds the equivalent of$1,500; and (b) Beneficiaries receiving a Private Veterinarians Sub-Grant statements referred in Section I.D.7.(b) (i)-(iv). |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.D.8. Sub-Grants | Description :For the Graduate Incentive Program implemented pursuant toPart II.B.(iv) of the Project, the Recipient shall ensure that ARIS provides no more than the equivalent of one thousand Dollars($1,000) in veterinary equipment and medicine to each veterinary graduate. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.D.9. Sub-Grants | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that ARIS exercises its rightsunder each Sub-Grant Agreement in such manner as to protect the interestsof the Recipient and the Association and to accomplish thepurposes of the Financing. Except as the Association shall otherwise agree, the Recipient shall ensure that ARIS does not assign,amend, abrogate or waive any Sub-Grant Agreement or any of its provisions. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.E.1. and 2. Safeguards | Description :The Recipient, through the APIU, shall and shallcause ARIS to carry out respective parts of the Project in accordance with the provisions of the Pest Management Framework andEnvironmental and Social Management Plan. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.E.3. Safeguards | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that ARIS, prior to thecommencement of any works through Sub-Grants provided under Part I.A(v), Part I.C(iv), Part II.A(i), and Part II.B(ii) of theProject, prepares a Site-Specific ESMP in accordance with the PMF, ESMP, and the Project Operational Manual. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.E.4. Safeguards | Description :The Recipient shall not undertake any Project activitiesthat involve involuntary land acquisition or resettlement of people or loss of assets or income. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.E.5. Safeguards | Description :The Recipient shall cause ARIS, prior to approval of anyPUU Sub-grants which involve temporary or permanent acquisition of privately-owned land, to require the respective PUU to providesatisfactory evidence that: (i) the terms of land acquisition have been properly negotiated with the land owner, and (ii) adequatecontractual arrangements have been entered into between the parties. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.E.6. Safeguards | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that prior to carrying outpasture boundary demarcation activities, it has established guidelines for public disclosure of complaints, dispute resolution, andmonitoring of dispute resolution mechanisms. | Frequency :Yearly

Number of Community Pasture Management Plans implemented satisfactorily based on Project PUU performance criteria.
Number of Animal Health and Husbandry Plans implemented satisfactorily based on based on Project PUU performance criteria.
